summary: This bill proposes awarding a Congressional Gold Medal to the women who served in the U.S. Army Nurse Corps and U.S. Navy Nurse Corps during World War II. It details their contributions, including service under fire, prisoner-of-war experiences, and care for victims of the war. The bill authorizes the striking of a gold medal, its display at the Smithsonian Institution and other related locations, and the sale of bronze duplicates. It also specifies that medals are national medals and numismatic items.
